meanings.definition: To drive away or urge to go away by or as if by crying "shoo"
meanings.sent1: The cat shooed the birds away from the garden.
meanings.sent2: She shooed the flies out of the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The children shooed the imaginary monsters under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise shooed away all thoughts of sleep.
meanings.sent5: The teacher shooed the students out of the classroom at the end of the day.

meanings.definition: To cause to move, leave, or go away by or as if by crying "shoo"
meanings.sent1: He shooed the dog off the couch.
meanings.sent2: The security guard shooed the trespassers away from the property.
meanings.sent3: The magician shooed the rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds shooed the beachgoers back to their cars.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh cookies shooed everyone into the kitchen.
